> What are the Limitations of JUnit or Disadvantages of JUnit.

The biggest=
 limitation, in my view, is that the tests are written in Java.
As a conseq=
uence, they are hard to understand by non-technical people, and
therefore J=
unit is not a good tool for customer-driven testing.

> JUnit has three Tes=
tRunners.They are textui,swing,applet.

These are the TestRunners that come=
 (or came? Does Junit 4 still have them?)
with Junit. Other projects provid=
e their own TestRunners - Eclipse, Ant etc.
pp. You could even rather easil=
y write your own, if you needed to.

> JUnit can test only standalone proje=
cts.

I don't understand this at all. What do you mean by "standalone proje=
cts",
what other projects are there and why couldn't you use Junit to test =
them?

Curious, Ilja
